title: Start-ups set out to make coffee more sustainable - Financial Times
summary: The article discusses innovative uses of coffee waste in construction and the circular economy by turning coffee by-products into building materials and reusable cups, as well as addressing sustainability challenges in coffee production.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses innovative ways of repurposing coffee waste into building materials and reusable cups, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE - The article does not primarily focus on a new or significantly improved product or business process that differs from the firm's previous offerings.
green_product: TRUE - The article highlights the creation of green products like building materials and reusable cups from coffee waste, designed to reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycles.
green_process: TRUE - The article describes green processes that aim to minimize environmental impacts by repurposing coffee waste into construction materials and reusable cups, promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 236220 - Commercial and Institutional Building Construction, 325199 - All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing, 326199 - All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing, 423930 - Recyclable Material Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE - The article highlights genuine efforts in repurposing coffee waste and adopting circular economy principles, without making false or misleading claims about environmental benefits.

title: ESGL Holdings Limited (NASDAQ: ESGL) Announces Multi-Year Contract Renewal with Singapore Refining Company ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: Environmental Solutions Group Holdings Limited announced a contract renewal with Singapore Refining Company for used catalyst waste disposal services, emphasizing circular economy solutions.

title: Reboxed® secures £1.6 million Seed investment led by ACF Investors - UK Tech Investment News
summary: Reboxed, a sustainable tech startup, secures funding to rehome electronic devices and accelerate the move to a circular economy.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation because Reboxed aims to solve the e-waste crisis by rehoming electronic devices and promoting a circular economy, thus contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. Reboxed introducing sustainable tech solutions and partnering with retailers for a circular economy qualifies as a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. Reboxed provides premium refurbished and pre-owned technology devices, focusing on quality, sustainability, and a circular approach, meeting the criteria of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. Reboxed's initiative to reduce e-waste, promote recommerce, and implement sustainable retailing practices characterizes it as a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 443142 - Electronics Stores, 541519 - Other Computer Related Services, 334310 - Audio and Video Equipment Manufacturing, 423940 - Jewelry, Watch, Precious Stone, and Precious Metal Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE. The article showcases Reboxed's tangible efforts in sustainability and circular economy practices, indicating a genuine commitment rather than greenwashing.
